title: Fix datetime timezone bug in Phase 2 tools

title: resolve_device tool - confirm device selection

Confirm device selection before telemetry queries. Prevents wrong-device from ambiguous fuzzy matches.

When user provides device name (not ID), search could match multiple devices. LLM should call this BEFORE get_device_telemetry when uncertain.

- search: str (device name search term)
- tenant_id: int | None (optional filter)
- limit: int = 5 (max candidates)

## Response
- Ranked list of matching devices
- Match confidence (exact/partial/fuzzy)
- Tenant context for each
- Device IDs for precise selection

title: get_device_telemetry tool - core time-series query
description:
Core Phase 2 tool. Fetch aggregated telemetry data for a device.

## Key Features
- Adaptive bucketing based on time range
- Multiple aggregation stats (avg, min, max, sum, count)
- Period-based or explicit date range
- Quantity semantic search support

## Parameters
- device_id/device_name: device selection
- quantity_id/quantity_search: metric selection
- period OR start_date/end_date: time range
- bucket: '15min', '1hour', '1day', 'auto'

## Adaptive Buckets
- ≤24h → 15min buckets
- ≤7d → 1hour buckets
- ≤30d → 4hour buckets
- ≤90d → 1day buckets
- >90d → 1week buckets

## Data Source
Primary: telemetry_15min_agg (2 years)
Fallback: telemetry_data (14 days raw)

## See also
docs/phase2-telemetry.md for full spec
close_reason: Closed

title: Fix time_bucket interval parameter handling in telemetry queries
description:
asyncpg.exceptions.DataError: invalid input for query argument: '15 minutes' ('str' object has no attribute 'days')

The time_bucket function receives interval as string (e.g. '15 minutes', '1 hour') but asyncpg cannot convert it properly even with ::interval cast.

Affected tests:
- test_power_consumption_24h
- test_energy_usage_last_week  
- test_custom_date_range
- test_current_readings_yesterday
- test_peak_* tests
- test_group_* telemetry tests

Fix options:
1. Use PostgreSQL interval syntax directly in query
2. Use timedelta objects instead of strings
3. Investigate asyncpg interval parameter handling
close_reason: Fixed time_bucket interval handling by using timedelta objects instead of strings. Also fixed placeholder position bug in peak_analysis stats_query. 15 tests now passing. Remaining 2 failures are pre-existing test/implementation mismatches.
